text: Robert James Tennent (1803 – 25 May 1880) was an Irish Whig politician. Born in Belfast and the son of Robert Tennent Tennent and Eliza née Macrone, Tennent was admitted to Trinity College Dublin in July 1820, before volunteering in the Greek War of Independence in 1824. He was then admitted at Lincoln's Inn in 1826, and called to the Irish Bar in 1833, when he was also then admitted at Trinity College, Cambridge. In 1834, he was called to the English Bar. Tennent married Eliza, daughter of John McCracken in 1830, and they had at least one child: Robert Tennent, born in 1854. Tennent was elected as a Whig Member of Parliament (MP) for Belfast at the 1847 general election and held the seat until 1852, when he was defeated. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Whig (British political party) MPs for Irish constituencies Category:UK MPs 1847–1852 Category:1803 births Category:1880 deaths Category:Members of the Parliament of the United Kingdom for Belfast constituencies (1801–1922) Category:Politicians from Belfast Category:Members of Lincoln's Inn Category:Lawyers from Belfast Category:Irish barristers Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin
title: Robert James Tennent
